model_answer:
We refer to Wikipedia articles on chemistry for help. The hand in the figure is pointing at the activation energy, which is represented by the peak of the curve labeled 'Ea' (activation energy).

Therefore, the answer is (A).

The visual cues that indicate the exothermic release of energy at the same time as the temperature rise are (B) the product energy line being drawn lower than the reactant energy line and (D) an "endothermic" label beside an uphill curve being highlighted. These diagrams typically show the change in energy (ΔE) as a function of temperature (T), and an endothermic reaction would have a negative ΔE value and an upward curve on the T-axis.
